parts.text:
```json
{
  "application": "ICON",
  "software": [
    "NEC MPI",
    "OpenMP",
    "GFORTRAN"
  ],
  "resources": [
    "PBS queue",
    "VE nodes",
    "HCA",
    "MPI processes",
    "OpenMP threads",
    "Input data: grids, external parameters",
    "Namelists",
    "Model binaries"
  ],
  "configuration": {
    "queue": "sx_norm",
    "ve_nodes": 1,
    "cores_per_node": 8,
    "mpi_root": "/opt/nec/ve/mpi/2.3.1",
    "mpi_malloc_heap_expansion_size": 512,
    "mpi_malloc_mmap_threshold": 512,
    "mpi_ib_vbuf_total_size": 131072,
    "mpi_daemon_path": "/opt/nec/ve/mpi/2.3.1/libexec/mpid",
    "run_time": "00:40:00",
    "hca_per_node": 2,
    "cpu_per_job": 2,
    "cores_per_process": 0,
    "openmp_threads": 1,
    "input_data_root": "/hpc/rwork0/routfor/test/icon/Checksuite_data/",
    "model_binary": "/opt/nec/ve/bin/mpirun"
  }
}
```

The script launches the ICON (ICOsahedral Nonhydrostatic) atmospheric model using NEC MPI for parallel execution and OpenMP for multi-threading. It utilizes PBS (Portable Batch System) for job submission and resource allocation. The script sets up various parameters for the model and its execution environment, including:

- **NEC MPI:** Configured for inter-node communication and parallelization.
- **OpenMP:** Configured for multi-threading within each node.
- **PBS:** Used for submitting the job to the queue, specifying resource requirements (nodes, cores, time), and managing output.
- **Input data:** Links symbolic links to the necessary grid files from a specified location.
- **Namelists:** Defines the parameters for the ICON model execution.
- **Model binaries:** Specifies the paths to the compiled binaries for the ICON model.

This script appears to be setting up a single-node execution with one VE (Vector Engine) and multiple cores. The configuration ensures specific environment variables and settings related to memory management, error handling, and tracing. The output of the model will be directed to a log file named "LOG.exp.run_ICON_02_R2B13_lam.run.run.o".
